data.content: Congratulations! We are pleased to offer a retirement savings plan to eligible employees. Start planning by choosing how much you want to save or by learning more about your plan.
Your employer will match your contributions up to x%...

Disclousures

1) A.C.S. “Too thin a cushion” Economist, 2 April 2013 Web 22 June 2014. <http://www.economist.com/blogs/freeexchange/2013/04/saving>
The plan your employer is offering has many features that will make saving for retirement easier and more effective.

Disclousures

1) Wesley, Daniel. “How The Average U.S. Consumer Spends Their Paycheck.” Credit Loan.com 25 Sept. 2013. Web. 22 June 2014. <creditloan.com/blog/how-the-average-us-consumer-spends-their-paycheck/>
[VARIABLE TEXT] Employer Matching Funds - Congratulations, your employer is helping you move toward a more secure retirement by contributing: XXXXXXXXXXXX
What's your personal path to a retirement that will replace your income and be rewarding? Take a moment to reflect on the future to make sure it gives you what you truly desire.

Disclousures

1) Source: 2014 Social Security Administration. Visit ssa.gov/planners/lifeexpectancy.
2) This example is hypothetical and for illustrative purposes onl
3) Social Security Retirement Estimator, http://www.ssa.gov/estimator/. This chart assumes a normal retirement age of 67 and is for illustrative purposes only. To estimate your own Social Security benefits, call 800.772.1213 or visit www.ssa.gov for a personal Earnings and Benefit Estimate statement.

Disclousures

1) Disclosure: This chart assumes that the account earns an average annual rate of return of XXX percent. This example is hypothetical and for illustrative purposes only and is not indicative of the performance of any specific investment or investment portfolio.

Disclousures

1) Epperson, Sharon. “Afford to Retire? More are Confident, But Few Save Enough.” NBC News. 18 March 2014. Web. 23 June 2014. <nbcnews.com/business/retirement/afford-retire-more-are-confident-few-save-enough-n55691>
Your greatest allies in successful investing are time, discipline and knowledge. Explore some of the basics of investing and get some knowledge that can make a difference.
